text: Jaspillite, or jaspilite, is a chemical rock formed similar to chert. It is usually iron rich. It also has the name jasper taconite. Jaspillite is typically a layered mixture of hematite and quartz. It is common in the banded iron formation rocks of Proterozoic and Archaean age in the Canadian shield of North America. Jaspillite is also a sedimentary rock.in certain lead-zinc ore deposits. It is used as a gemstone.Gemstones of North America - Volume 1, John Sinkankas - 1959 p.345 == References == == Other websites == *Mindat.org data Category:Sedimentary rocks Category:Gemstones
title: Jaspillite
